Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: Jane Austen is the author of the classic novel 'Pride and Prejudice', published in 1813.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Jay Gatsby?
Questions.Explanation: Jay Gatsby is a central character in F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel 'The Great Gatsby', published in 1925.

Questions.Question: In which city is Charles Dickens' novel 'A Tale of Two Cities' primarily set?
Questions.Explanation: Charles Dickens' novel 'A Tale of Two Cities' is primarily set in London during the French Revolution.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: William Shakespeare is the playwright behind the tragic love story 'Romeo and Juliet', written in the late 16th century.

Questions.Question: Which novel is set in the fictional land of Middle-earth?
Questions.Explanation: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy novel 'The Lord of the Rings' is set in the fictional land of Middle-earth.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Questions.Explanation: Harper Lee is the author of the classic novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird', published in 1960.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Holden Caulfield?
Questions.Explanation: Holden Caulfield is the protagonist in J.D. Salinger's novel 'The Catcher in the Rye', published in 1951.

Questions.Question: In which country is the novel 'One Hundred Years of Solitude' primarily set?
Questions.Explanation: Gabriel Garcia Marquez's novel 'One Hundred Years of Solitude' is primarily set in Colombia.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Hamlet'?
Questions.Explanation: William Shakespeare is the playwright behind the tragedy 'Hamlet', written in the early 17th century.

Questions.Question: Which novel is set during the Russian Revolution?
Questions.Explanation: George Orwell's allegorical novella 'Animal Farm' is set during the Russian Revolution.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'Jane Eyre'?
Questions.Explanation: Charlotte Bronte is the author of the classic novel 'Jane Eyre', published in 1847.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Elizabeth Bennet?
Questions.Explanation: Elizabeth Bennet is the protagonist in Jane Austen's novel 'Pride and Prejudice', published in 1813.

Questions.Question: In which city is Fyodor Dostoevsky's novel 'Crime and Punishment' primarily set?
Questions.Explanation: Fyodor Dostoevsky's novel 'Crime and Punishment' is primarily set in Saint Petersburg, Russia.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Macbeth'?
Questions.Explanation: William Shakespeare is the playwright behind the tragedy 'Macbeth', written in the early 17th century.

Questions.Question: Which novel is set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama?
Questions.Explanation: Harper Lee's novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' is set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, during the 1930s.

Questions.Question: In which country is the novel 'Don Quixote' primarily set?
Questions.Explanation: Miguel de Cervantes' novel 'Don Quixote' is primarily set in Spain during the 17th century.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'Moby-Dick'?
Questions.Explanation: Herman Melville is the author of the classic novel 'Moby-Dick', published in 1851.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Scout Finch?
Questions.Explanation: Scout Finch is the young protagonist in Harper Lee's novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

Questions.Question: In which city is F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel 'The Great Gatsby' primarily set?
Questions.Explanation: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel 'The Great Gatsby' is primarily set in New York during the Roaring Twenties.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: William Shakespeare is the playwright behind the tragic love story 'Romeo and Juliet', written in the late 16th century.
